title.narrative: Provision of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Services Targeting Displaced Populations Hosted in Camp and Camp-like Settings and Hosting Communities in North-East Nigeria.

description.narrative: The recent cholera outbreak and COVID-19 pandemic wave in displacement sites and surrounding communities across Borno, Adamawa, and Yobe States in Nigeria have significantly increased the need for water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services and facilities in settlements. This need has been exacerbated by heavy rainfall and windstorm in the past few weeks, which has resulted in damages to and destruction of WASH facilities. Furthermore, the general lack of hygiene items and hygiene awareness among affected populations is impeding safe water collection and storage and other good hygiene practices. In response to the needs that have been identified by the WASH Sector and in line with the Nigeria Humanitarian Fund (NHF) Allocation Strategy, this project is supporting the continuation and scaling-up of WASH assistance in north-east Nigeria. Current priorities, that this project is addressing includes: supporting the WASH Sector partners through WASH non-food items core pipeline management; improving access to safe water through the care and maintenance of water systems; providing improved sanitation through the construction, care and maintenance of sanitation facilities; and improving hygiene through increased awareness on hygiene, COVID-19, acute watery diarrhea and cholera through targeted messaging as well as environmental sanitation or solid waste management.
